conclusion: Analyze the process to determine the time of induced current in the frame.
The frame starts moving from the left side toward the magnetic field with side length \( l \) and magnetic field width \( d \).
The frame enters the magnetic field when the left edge reaches the left boundary, starting at \( t_1 = 0 \).
The entire frame is inside the magnetic field when the right edge enters, requiring time \( t_2 = \frac{l}{v} \).
The frame starts to exit the magnetic field when the left edge reaches the right boundary, requiring time \( t_3 = \frac{d}{v} \).
The entire frame exits the magnetic field when the right edge clears the right boundary, requiring time \( t_4 = \frac{d + l}{v} \).
Induced current duration is from \( t_2 \) to \( t_4 \).
Calculate the time duration \( \Delta t = \frac{d + l}{v} - \frac{l}{v} = \frac{d}{v} \).
The time during which there is an induced current in the frame is \( \frac{d}{v} \).
